definition: a time characterized by a particular circumstance or feature
examples: in a season of religious awakening

definition: a suitable or natural time or occasion
examples: when my season comes to sit on David's throne

definition: an indefinite period of time : while
examples: sent home again to her father for a season

definition: a period of the year characterized by or associated with a particular activity or phenomenon, such as, a period associated with some phase or activity of agriculture (such as growth or harvesting), a period in which an animal engages in some activity (such as migrating or mating), estrus, heat, the period normally characterized by a particular kind of weather, a period marked by special activity especially in some field, a period in which a place is most frequented
one of the four quarters into which the year is commonly divided
the time of a major holiday
a period of time when a series of new television shows, plays, etc., are being shown or performed
examples: a show entering its second season
the first/best episode of the season

definition: year
seasoning
the schedule of official games played or to be played by a sports team during a playing season
off-season
at the right time
at the stage of greatest fitness (as for eating)
legally available to be hunted or caught
not in season
to give (food) more flavor or zest by adding seasoning or savory ingredients
to give a distinctive quality to as if by seasoning, to make more agreeable
to qualify by admixture : temper
to treat (something, such as wood or a skillet) so as to prepare for use
to make fit by experience
to become seasoned
